column4: any one knows whats faster eee pc with xp or with ubuntu or eeebuntu
any one knows what's faster an Eee pc with xp or with ubuntu or eeebuntu
guess it all depends, does it have an SSD, or a regular hard drive
if you're not going to answer a response, then why repeat the question?
its a Eee pc 1000 ha so its a 160 gb hd
then i don't think you'd see a difference between any ubuntu, eeeubuntu or xubuntu... my AAO runs fantastic w/ 8.10
why don't you just either 1... boot an ubuntu cd, or 2... put ubuntu on a thumb drive, and boot it, and see how it goes.
id o know, your wireless probably isn't going to work out of the box... do you know if you have the atheros wireless device, or the realtek one?
i belive its the realtek one
yeah, those are kind of a pain
i've search the forum and apparently they do run with the eeebuntu mod kernel
hows the boot time one Aao
well, you can get it to work w/ "regular" 8.10... just take some works, but that might be one reason to choose eee, is for the kernel w/ the realtek driver
i have no complaints about its boot time.. i've never timed it, but its similar to my workhorse laptop.
fearful: i'm going to go with the eeebuntu version thx for all the help, my only concern is that the win xp versions boots on la 35 seconds hope i can match it
probably a good idea w/ that realtek deiice good luck
